metadata.synopsis: Player found Cazador, Astarion's master without Astarion in the party.Player told about this Astarion and Astarion is not very happy about the fact that the Player went to Cazador without him in the party.

31.speaker: Astarion
31.text: You went after Cazador without me? And why in all the Hells would you do that?

10.speaker: Player
10.text: I was just trying to help.

59.speaker: Astarion
59.text: If you wanted to help, you should have asked me. This is too important for you to handle without me.

35.speaker: Astarion
35.text: But what's done is done. And if he's expecting you to bring me in, maybe we can turn this to our advantage.

33.speaker: Astarion
33.text: Especially if you've already cleared a path through the security he'd put in place.
33.context: InternalNodeContext: Player already opened the Ballroom door and defeated the werewolves

45.speaker: Player
45.text: The palace is clear - we can walk straight in.

36.speaker: Astarion
36.text: Well, that does make things easier.

58.speaker: Astarion
58.text: He won't throw the doors open for us, he's no fool, but there may be fewer obstacles in our path if he's expecting us.

5.speaker: Player
5.text: But he wants me to bring you in - why would he put up obstacles to stop us?

42.speaker: Astarion
42.text: Because why would Cazador welcome you into his inner sanctum if his lackeys can kill you and deliver me to him?

2.speaker: Astarion
2.text: It's simply more efficient than killing you himself.

20.speaker: Astarion
20.text: Our next step is to get me to him.

51.speaker: Astarion
51.text: All you have to do is lead me to Cazador. I can handle him once we get there.

19.speaker: Player
19.text: Actually, I need you to wait here for now.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: Actually, I need you to wait at camp for now.

24.speaker: Astarion
24.text: You can't be serious. You want me to sit by the fire, twiddling my thumbs, when I could be winning my freedom?

50.speaker: Astarion
50.text: Even if I agreed to, I can hardly make it to our camp from here. At least for now, you're stuck with me.
50.context: NodeContext: Plays when you're in a location where camp isn't available, eg. a very dangerous area, another dimension, flying through Hell, etc.

9.speaker: Astarion
9.text: This is my fight. Don't you understand? I need to do this.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: Sounds good to me. We'll face him together.

14.speaker: Astarion
14.text: Thank you. I won't forget this.

12.speaker: Astarion
12.text: Let's do this. Let's go kill the bastard.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: If you're sure you can do this...

6.speaker: Astarion
6.text: It's not an issue of 'can', it's an issue of 'must'.

22.speaker: Astarion
22.text: I have to face him or I'll never be free.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: Trust me, I know what I'm doing. Just stay here.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: Trust me, I know what I'm doing. Just stay in camp.

26.speaker: Astarion
26.text: All right. I suppose you've earned a little trust. But only a little.

32.speaker: Astarion
32.text: I can join you tomorrow? I hardly want to sit in this camp when I could be out there, getting justice.

18.speaker: Astarion
18.text: You have a full roster already though. You'll need to leave someone behind.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: Please stay here for now. I'll get you when the time's right.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: Don't worry about Cazador. I'll take care of him.

13.speaker: Astarion
13.text: You can't mean that. You want me to sit by the fire while you kill Cazador?

56.speaker: Astarion
56.text: This is my fight, don't you understand? It's not enough that he dies - I need to kill him.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: All right, then join me. We'll face him together.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: All right, then join me. We'll face him together.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: All right, I'll ask someone to wait here.

40.speaker: Player
40.text: Trust me, I know what I'm doing. Just stay here.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: Trust me, I know what I'm doing. Just stay in camp.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: Are you sure? It feels like a trap.

16.speaker: Astarion
16.text: Well of course it's a trap! But now we know it's a trap, and that's half the battle.

7.speaker: Astarion
7.text: Not literally, of course. The actual battle will be long and intense. But at least we have some idea of what we're walking into.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: See? I knew what I was doing.

38.speaker: Astarion
38.text: You absolutely did not. But sometimes fortune shines on us all the same.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: I was gathering information, that's all.

17.speaker: Player
17.text: Maybe I wanted to know how much he'd pay to get you back.

54.speaker: Astarion
54.text: Very funny. If you're telling me this now, I assume it wasn't enough.

39.speaker: Astarion
39.text: But maybe this isn't so bad. Perhaps it could even work to our advantage.
